thread.title: Selling Tupelo, Elvis to the Brits
thread.title_full: Selling Tupelo, Elvis to the Brits - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Selling Tupelo, Elvis to the Brits
text:
TUPELO, Miss. (AP) - Tupelo tourism officials will spend a week in England next month selling the city and the Elvis Presley Birthplace as destinations.
The Northeast Mississippi Daily Journal ( http://bit.ly/1GcaqEQ ) reports Tupelo Convention and Visitor Bureau director Neal McCoy said Tupelo was invited to take part in "Elvis at the 02," which is billed as the largest Elvis exhibition ever in Europe.
McCoy says the exhibit - which shows some items that had never before left Graceland - was supposed to be a nine-month show, ending in August, but because it's been so successful, they extended it three months.
McCoy, the bureau's international sales director, Jennie Curlee, and Mayor Jason Shelton will fly to London on Sunday, Nov. 1, and return the following Friday.
Information from: Northeast Mississippi Daily Journal, http://djournal.com
